name: Casas-Alvero conjecture
rephrased: If a polynomial and all its derivatives up to the (d-1)-th derivative share a common root, then the polynomial must have only one distinct root (i.e., it is a power of a linear polynomial).
implication_form: If a univariate polynomial of degree d has a common root with each of its first d-1 derivatives, then it has only one distinct root.
